pr_title: [15025] Use GA APIs for XML Binding/WebSvcs/etc. and rename features

timeline.message:
[15025] Use GA APIs for XML Binding/WebSvcs/etc. and rename features

- Renaming from old trademarked feature names to EE9-approved names.
- Pulling in GA APIs for XML Binding, XML Web Services, Web Services
Metadata and XML SOAP.

timeline.bodyText: I assume this is just git being funny and mismatching the project names after the rename, but just want to point it out just in case.
timeline.author: neuwerk

replies.bodyText: Yeah it is.  You can see it in the other one as well.  It did its best.
replies.author: jhanders34

timeline.bodyText: Should we change the feature name as well from jaxb to xmlBinding?
timeline.author: jhanders34
jhanders34
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -12,16 +12,16 @@ IBM-API-Package: \
   jakarta.xml.bind.attachment;  type="spec", \
   jakarta.xml.bind.helpers;  type="spec", \
   jakarta.xml.bind.util;  type="spec"
-IBM-ShortName: jaxb-3.0
+IBM-ShortName: xmlBinding-3.0

timeline.bodyText:
Please add:
WLP-AlsoKnownAs: jaxws-3.0
Also add dependency on feature
com.ibm.websphere.appserver.eeCompatible-9.0
And consider adding:
WLP-Activation-Type: parallel
timeline.author: jhanders34

replies.bodyText: Also the NLS files may need to be updated to remove reference to JAX-WS
replies.author: jhanders34

replies.bodyText: Did you decide not to update the nls files for this feature?  They reference JAX-WS in them.
replies.author: jhanders34

timeline.bodyText: Since xmlWS-3.0 isn't a thing yet that can be really enabled, does this cause test failures?
timeline.author: jhanders34
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -27,7 +27,8 @@ tested.features: \
         messagingClient-3.0,\
         messagingServer-3.0,\
         messaging-3.0,\
-        jakartaeeClient-9.0
+        jakartaeeClient-9.0,\
+        xmlWS-3.0

replies.bodyText: it caused test failures without it... my guess is that the FAT test uses stuff from the APIs, but not the impl itself.
replies.author: andymc12

timeline.bodyText: Should this bundle name and symbolic name change to remove reference to jaxb?
timeline.author: jhanders34

timeline.bodyText: Should the package name change to be xmlbinding instead of jaxb?
timeline.author: jhanders34
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -16,8 +16,8 @@ Bundle-Name: IBM JAXB SchemaGen Tool
 
 Require-Compiler: true
 
-Require-Bundle: io.openliberty.jaxb.3.0.internal.tools; version="[1,1.0.100)", \
- io.openliberty.jakarta.jaxb.3.0; version="[1,1.0.100)"; location="dev/api/spec/", \
+Require-Bundle: io.openliberty.xmlBinding.3.0.internal.tools; version="[1,1.0.100)", \
+ io.openliberty.jakarta.xmlBinding.3.0; version="[1,1.0.100)"; location="dev/api/spec/", \
  com.ibm.ws.logging; version="[1,1.0.100)"
  
 Command-Class: io.openliberty.jaxb.tools.SchemaGen

timeline.bodyText: Should this bundle name and symbolic name change to remove reference to jaxb?
timeline.author: jhanders34

timeline.bodyText: Should the package name change to be xmlbinding instead of jaxb?
timeline.author: jhanders34
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -16,8 +16,8 @@ Bundle-Name: IBM JAXB XJC Tool
 
 Require-Compiler: true
 
-Require-Bundle: io.openliberty.jaxb.3.0.internal.tools; version="[1,1.0.100)", \
- io.openliberty.jakarta.jaxb.3.0; version="[1,1.0.100)"; location="dev/api/spec/", \ \
+Require-Bundle: io.openliberty.xmlBinding.3.0.internal.tools; version="[1,1.0.100)", \
+ io.openliberty.jakarta.xmlBinding.3.0; version="[1,1.0.100)"; location="dev/api/spec/", \ \
  com.ibm.ws.logging; version="[1,1.0.100)"
  
 Command-Class: io.openliberty.jaxb.tools.XJC

replies.bodyText: Should the nls files paths be updated to remove reference to jaxb in the package?  Also the nls files should be updated to remove reference to JAXB.
replies.author: jhanders34

replies.bodyText: As pointed out in another review comment the nls files didn't move to a new location.
replies.author: jhanders34

timeline.message:
[15025] Use GA APIs for XML Binding/WebSvcs/etc. and rename features

- Renaming from old trademarked feature names to EE9-approved names.
- Pulling in GA APIs for XML Binding, XML Web Services, Web Services
Metadata and XML SOAP.

timeline.bodyText: The , \ is missing.  Not sure what happened, but it was removed.
timeline.author: jhanders34
jhanders34
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -40,7 +40,7 @@ Subsystem-Name: Jakarta Server Faces 3.0
  io.openliberty.jakarta.validation-3.0, \
  io.openliberty.jakarta.faces-3.0, \
  io.openliberty.pages-3.0, \
- io.openliberty.jakarta.jaxb-3.0; \
+ io.openliberty.jakarta.xmlBinding-3.0; \

replies.bodyText: agreed - though that was there before...  I'll change it.
replies.author: andymc12

timeline.bodyText: You changed this here, but the file is still io.openliberty.jaxb in reality.  Also JaxbToolsMessages should be changed as well it would seem.
timeline.author: jhanders34

replies.bodyText: Should the TR_GROUP also be updated?
replies.author: jhanders34

replies.bodyText: I think this is going a bit too far. There are still plenty of classes that start with Jaxb in the XML Binding APIs.  If the spec project didn't need to rename their classes, I don't see why we would have to.
replies.author: andymc12

timeline.bodyText:
I think now with the other changes you made you can do:
-files=\
  bin/xmlBinding/xjc.bat, \
  bin/xmlBinding/tools/ws-schemagen.jar, \
  bin/xmlBinding/schemagen; ibm.executable:=true; ibm.file.encoding:=ebcdic, \
  bin/xmlBinding/xjc; ibm.executable:=true; ibm.file.encoding:=ebcdic, \
  bin/xmlBinding/tools/ws-xjc.jar, \
  bin/xmlBinding/schemagen.bat
timeline.author: jhanders34
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -12,16 +12,17 @@ IBM-API-Package: \
   jakarta.xml.bind.attachment;  type="spec", \
   jakarta.xml.bind.helpers;  type="spec", \
   jakarta.xml.bind.util;  type="spec"
-IBM-ShortName: jaxb-3.0
+IBM-ShortName: xmlBinding-3.0
 IBM-Process-Types: client, \
  server
 Subsystem-Name: Jakarta XML Bindings 3.0
 -features=\
   com.ibm.websphere.appserver.classloading-1.0, \
   com.ibm.websphere.appserver.eeCompatible-9.0, \
-  io.openliberty.jakarta.jaxb-3.0
+  io.openliberty.jakarta.xmlBinding-3.0
 -bundles=\
-  io.openliberty.jaxb.3.0.internal.tools
+  io.openliberty.xmlBinding.3.0.internal.tools

replies.bodyText: This assumes that the files are created in that location. After you ran your local build do you see the files I am referencing here?
replies.author: jhanders34
